user_stories.title: As a Test Engineer, I want to define an LLM test case with a name, description, and input parameters so that I can clearly identify and categorize my tests.
user_stories.description: This story focuses on allowing a Test Engineer to create the basic metadata for an LLM test case, including a unique identifier, a human-readable description, and specified input variables that the LLM will receive during testing.
acceptance_criteria: The system allows creation of a new LLM test case definition.
A test case can be assigned a unique name (string).
A test case can have an optional description (text field).
A test case can define one or more input parameters, each with a name and type (e.g., 'prompt': 'string', 'temperature': 'float').
Input parameters can be added, edited, and removed from a test case definition.

tasks.title: Design LLM Test Case Data Model
tasks.description: Define the database schema or data structure for an LLM test case, including fields for name, description, and an array of input parameters with their respective names and types.

tasks.title: Implement API Endpoint for Creating Test Cases
tasks.description: Develop a RESTful API endpoint (e.g., POST /api/v1/llm-test-cases) that accepts a JSON payload for creating a new LLM test case definition.

tasks.title: Implement Input Parameter Validation
tasks.description: Add backend validation to ensure input parameter names are unique within a test case and types are recognized (e.g., string, integer, float, boolean).

tasks.title: Write Unit Tests for Test Case Creation API
tasks.description: Develop unit tests to verify the correct functionality of the API endpoint for creating LLM test cases, including success cases and error handling for invalid input.

user_stories.title: As a Test Engineer, I want to associate a specific LLM prompt template and expected output conditions with a test case so that I can define the core logic and success criteria for my LLM evaluation.
user_stories.description: This story enables the Test Engineer to define the actual prompt that will be fed to the LLM (potentially with placeholders for input parameters) and establish the conditions under which the LLM's response is considered successful.
acceptance_criteria: A test case definition can include a customizable prompt template (string with placeholders).
A test case definition can include one or more expected output conditions (e.g., 'contains string 'hello'', 'matches regex /pattern/', 'sentiment is positive', 'JSON is valid').
Expected output conditions can be added, edited, and removed from a test case.
The prompt template can reference previously defined input parameters.

tasks.title: Extend LLM Test Case Data Model for Prompt and Expectations
tasks.description: Update the data model to include fields for a 'prompt_template' (string) and an array of 'expected_outputs', where each expectation has a 'type' and 'value'.

tasks.title: Implement API Endpoint for Updating Test Cases
tasks.description: Develop a RESTful API endpoint (e.g., PUT /api/v1/llm-test-cases/{id}) that allows modifying an existing LLM test case, including its prompt template and expected output conditions.

tasks.title: Design Expectation Type System
tasks.description: Define a set of supported expectation types (e.g., 'contains', 'regex', 'json_valid', 'sentiment_positive') and their corresponding data structures.

tasks.title: Develop Service Layer for Test Case Definition Management
tasks.description: Implement the business logic layer responsible for handling the creation and modification of LLM test cases, including prompt template parsing and expectation management.

tasks.title: Create Integration Tests for Test Case Updates
tasks.description: Write integration tests that cover updating a test case with a prompt template and various types of expected output conditions, ensuring data persistence and integrity.

user_stories.title: As a DevOps Engineer, I want the LLM test case definition API to be versioned and include robust error handling so that I can integrate it reliably into CI/CD pipelines.
user_stories.description: This story focuses on the non-functional requirements vital for the maintainability and reliability of the API, ensuring it's production-ready for automated systems.
acceptance_criteria: All API endpoints are explicitly versioned (e.g., /api/v1/).
API calls with invalid data or non-existent resources return appropriate HTTP status codes (e.g., 400 Bad Request, 404 Not Found, 409 Conflict).
Error responses include a standardized JSON payload with an error code and a human-readable message.
The API documentation clearly defines expected request and response formats, including error structures.

tasks.title: Implement API Versioning Strategy
tasks.description: Apply a clear versioning strategy (e.g., URL-based /v1/) to all newly developed API endpoints for LLM test case definition.

tasks.title: Standardize API Error Response Format
tasks.description: Define and implement a consistent JSON structure for all API error responses, including fields like 'error_code', 'message', and 'details'.

tasks.title: Integrate Global Exception Handling
tasks.description: Implement a global exception handling mechanism within the API framework to catch unhandled errors and return standardized error responses.

tasks.title: Document API Error Cases in OpenAPI Spec
tasks.description: Update the OpenAPI/Swagger documentation to explicitly describe all possible error responses and their corresponding HTTP status codes for the test case definition API.
